slides.title: Fire
slides.content:
# The First Tech üî•

Controlled use of fire (Homo erectus, ~1MYA).
- Warmth, Cooking (Brain growth), Protection.
- The spark of civilization.

slides.title: The Wheel
slides.content:
# Rolling üé°

~3500 BC (Mesopotamia).
- Originally for pottery, then chariots.
- Revolutionized transport and machinery.

slides.title: Agriculture
slides.content:
# Farming üåæ

Neolithic Revolution (~10,000 BC).
- Shift from hunter-gatherer to settled life.
- Allowed surplus food $\to$ Cities $\to$ Specialization (Scientists!).

slides.title: Writing
slides.content:
# Memory üìú

~3400 BC (Sumerian Cuneiform).
- Storing information outside the brain.
- Passing knowledge across generations.

slides.title: Helicentrism
slides.content:
# Earth Moves üåé

Copernicus (1543).
- We are not the center.
- Humbling and revolutionary.
- Started modern astronomy.

slides.title: Space Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Heliocentrism proposes that what is at the center of the solar system?

slides.title: Microscope
slides.content:
# Tiny Worlds üî¨

Leeuwenhoek (1670s).
- Discovered "Animalcules" (Bacteria/Protozoa) in water.
- Nobody knew this life existed.
- Led to Germ Theory.

slides.title: Electricity
slides.content:
# The Force ‚ö°

Franklin (Kite), Volta (Battery), Faraday (Motor).
- From parlor trick to powering the planet.
- Instant communication (Telegraph).

slides.title: Vaccination
slides.content:
# Immunity üíâ

Edward Jenner (1796).
- Used Cowpox to protect against Smallpox.
- Louis Pasteur perfected it.
- Eradicated Smallpox, saved billions.

slides.title: Evolution
slides.content:
# Natural Selection  Darwin

1859.
- Explains diversity of life without magic.
- We are related to all living things.

slides.title: Penicillin
slides.content:
# Antibiotics üíä

Alexander Fleming (1928).
- Accidental discovery of mold killing bacteria.
- Turned fatal infections (strep throat, cuts) into minor nuisances.

slides.title: DNA
slides.content:
# Code of Life üß¨

1953.
- The instruction manual for building a human.
- Opened door to genetic engineering.

slides.title: Plate Tectonics
slides.content:
# Moving Earth üó∫Ô∏è

1960s (Wegener proposed earlier).
- Earth's crust moves.
- Explains volcanoes, earthquakes, mountains.

slides.title: Big Bang Theory
slides.content:
# The Beginning üí•

Hubble (1929) saw universe expanding.
- Penzias & Wilson (1964) heard the echo (CMB).
- Universe had a start ~13.8 Billion years ago.

slides.title: Transistor
slides.content:
# Digital Switch üíæ

1947.
- Replaced bulky vacuum tubes.
- Allowed computers to shrink from room-size to phone-size.
- Most manufactured object in history.

slides.title: Relativity
slides.content:
# E=mc¬≤ üåå

Einstein.
- Mass and Energy are interchangeable.
- Led to Nuclear Power (and bombs).
- Changed understanding of Space and Time.

slides.title: The Internet
slides.content:
# Connection üåê

ARPANET (1969) $\to$ WWW (1989, Tim Berners-Lee).
- Democratized information.
- Connected the human species.

slides.title: Discoveries Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- **Tools** (Fire, Wheel) gave us power.
- **Germs & DNA** saved our lives.
- **Physics** gave us the stars.
- Curiosity pays off.
